doc:
Gary Warren (actor) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gary_Warren_(actor) 0 Gary Warren (born 5 July 1954 in Cricklewood, London) is a British former child actor, best remembered for his role as Peter in the 1970 film The Railway Children. He also played Cedric Collingford ("Owl Face") in the TV series Catweazle (1971) and Taplow (the troublemaking pupil) in Whacko, and appeared in the sitcom Alexander the Greatest (1971) and played Mame's nephew in the West End musical Mame starring Ginger Rogers. In 1970, he released a single musical recording with two songs: "Lucky Guy" and "Jennifer Please".In October 2009 and September 2010, Gary was interviewed on BBC London 94.9 by Danny Baker. Gary_Warren ( born_5_July_1954 in Cricklewood , London ) is a_British_former_child_actor , best remembered for his_role as Peter in the_1970_film The_Railway_Children . He also played Cedric_Collingford_(_"_Owl_Face " ) in the_TV_series_Catweazle ( 1971_)_and_Taplow ( the_troublemaking_pupil_) in Whacko , and appeared in the_sitcom Alexander the_Greatest ( 1971_) and played Mame 's_nephew in the_West_End_musical_Mame starring Ginger_Rogers . In 1970 , he released a_single_musical_recording with two_songs : " Lucky_Guy_"_and_"_Jennifer_Please_" . In October_2009 and September_2010 , Gary was_interviewed on BBC_London_94.9 by Danny_Baker .
